page.title: 17West urban edge of Preston
page.content: (continued from page 16). There are many residential activities including a health centre, schools and shops. Finally, there are parts of two urban parks, Ashton and Haslam. North of this area, square 5131, is mostly residential with housing varying in age from the 1930s uptil today. The type of housing ranges from semi_detached to maisonettes.In the area are found a variety of residential features like churches, schools (one secondary and two primary ), public houses and social clubs. Much of the southern part of the area is taken up by the urban park mentionned previously, Haslam Park. It is separated from the residential area by the Lancaster Canal which passes east to west through the area. The south-west corner is crossed by the Preston to Blackpool railway line.
